prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
A US Army soldier stationed in South Korea has been detained in Russia, the US military says.

The Russian foreign ministry said the charges were not related to "politics or espionage", but to a "purely domestic crime".

The 34-year-old was not on official travel when he was held on 2 May in the city of Vladivostok, in Russia's Far East.

Sgt Black had been in the process of changing duty stations from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in the US state of Texas, according to a statement from the US Army.

But instead of returning to the US, he travelled through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons, US Army spokeswoman Cynthia Smith said in a statement.

According to Russian media, he was visiting a woman with whom he had a romantic relationship.

The soldier's mother, Melody Jones, confirmed to CBS that he was in Russia visiting his girlfriend.

"Please do not torture him [or] hurt him," Melody Jones said when asked about her message to the Russians.

Sgt Black enlisted as an infantryman in 2008 and was deployed to Iraq in 2009 and Afghanistan in 2013. He was most recently assigned to the Eighth Army, US Forces Korea at Camp Humphreys in South Korea.

He did not request official clearance and the defence department did not authorise his travel to China or Russia, the US Army said. There is no evidence he intended to remain in Russia.

The Russian interior ministry informed the US embassy in Moscow on 3 May that Sgt Black had been arrested a day earlier for theft of personal property.

He is being held at a pre-trial detention facility until his next hearing.

"The Army notified his family and the US Department of State is providing appropriate consular support to the Soldier in Russia," the US Army said in a statement on Monday.

National Security Council spokesman John Kirby told reporters the US is "aware of this case and other matters related to Russia".

At the White House briefing on Monday, Mr Kirby said he could not provide more details.

Russia is holding two other Americans. Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich has been detained since March 2023 on espionage charges.

Former US Marine Paul Whelan was accused of spying and sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020.

Both men maintain their innocence, and the US government says the charges against them are baseless.
stories: A US Army serviceman, who was stationed in South Korea and was in the process of transferring to Fort Cavazos in Texas, has been detained in Russia. The US military mentioned that the arrest did not involve political or espionage matters, but was due to a supposed domestic crime. The 34-year-old soldier, identified as Sgt Black, was not on official travel when he was detained in Vladivostok, Russia, on May 2nd. Instead of heading back to the US, he traveled through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons. According to Russian media, he was visiting a woman he had a romantic relationship with. Sgt Black's mother, Melody Jones, confirmed that he was in Russia to see his girlfriend. The soldier's family and the US Department of State have been informed and are providing consular support. The Russian interior ministry stated that Sgt Black was arrested for theft of personal property and is being held in a pre-trial detention facility. The US Army mentioned that Sgt Black did not have official clearance or authorization for his travel to China or Russia. The US is aware of this case and is holding two other Americans, Evan Gershkovich, a Wall Street Journal reporter detained in March 2023 on espionage charges, and former US Marine Paul Whelan, who was sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020 on spying charges. Both men deny the allegations, and the US government views the charges as groundless.

A US Army sergeant, previously based in South Korea and in the midst of relocating to Fort Cavazos in Texas, has been taken into custody in Russia. The US military has clarified that the arrest is not related to political or espionage issues, but rather stems from an alleged domestic crime. The 34-year-old soldier, named Sgt Black, was not on official business when he was apprehended in Vladivostok, Russia, on May 2nd. Rather than returning to the US, he chose to go to Vladivostok through China for personal reasons. Russian media reports that he was there to meet with a woman he had a romantic connection with, a detail that Sgt Black's mother, Melody Jones, has confirmed. The soldier's family and the US Department of State have been notified and are offering consular assistance. The Russian interior ministry has reported that Sgt Black was taken into custody for allegedly stealing personal property and is currently detained in a pre-trial facility. The US Army has stated that Sgt Black did not have official approval or authorization for his travel to China or Russia. The US is currently dealing with the cases of two other Americans: Evan Gershkovich, a Wall Street Journal reporter detained in March 2023 on espionage charges, and Paul Whelan, a former US Marine sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020 on spying charges. Both men deny the accusations, and the US government considers the charges to be baseless.
